importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The article reports on the opening of the NBA season, highlighting international player trends and league developments as of this date.
The NBA and FIBA are in talks about launching a new European league, which could happen as early as 2027, signaling a major expansion of the sport globally.
The NBA is projected to reach the milestone of 14 million total points scored in a game, which is expected to occur around this date based on average scoring trends.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The entire 2025 NBA season, starting with the opening night on October 21, is a key timeframe for tracking international participation, player milestones, and league-wide developments such as the All-Star Game format changes.

keyTakeAways: The NBA season opens with a record 135 players born outside the U.S., from 43 countries, with 71 from Europe, the highest number from that continent ever.
Canada has the most non-U.S. players with 23, followed by France (19) and Australia (13).
The Atlanta Hawks open the season with 10 international players, tying an NBA record.
All 30 NBA teams have at least one international player on their opening night rosters.
The NBA and FIBA are discussing launching a new European basketball league, potentially by 2027, to grow the game across Europe.
The last seven NBA MVPs have been awarded to players born outside the U.S., marking a significant shift in the league's talent base.
Oklahoma City’s Shai Gilgeous-Alexander (Canadian) and players like Nikola Jokić (Serbia), Giannis Antetokounmpo (Greece), and Joel Embiid (Cameroon-born) have won the last seven MVP awards.

LeBron James is set to break multiple records during the season, including becoming the 23rd player with 23 seasons in the league, and potentially surpassing Robert Parish and Kareem Abdul-Jabbar in career points and field goals.
The NBA is expected to finalize a new All-Star Game format where U.S. players face off against international players in a tournament.
Brooklyn Nets are considered one of the youngest teams, with no players among the league’s top 100 active scorers, and their roster combined has only 21,708 career points and 1,018 starts.
There are seven players named Jordan, five named Nikola, and five named James, highlighting a cultural trend in player naming across the league.
Orlando Robinson is the only player in the league wearing his first name on the front and last name on the back of his jersey.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The 2025 NBA season marks a historic moment in the globalization of basketball, with a record 135 players born outside the U.S. on opening night rosters from 43 countries, including 71 from Europe. Canada leads in non-U.S. players with 23, followed by France and Australia. The Atlanta Hawks tie an NBA record with 10 international players. The NBA and FIBA are in talks to launch a new European league by 2027, reflecting a strategic push to expand the game across the continent. The last seven NBA MVP awards have gone to players born outside the U.S., signaling a major shift in the league’s talent base. Key milestones include LeBron James’s 23rd season and potential record-breaking achievements in points and field goals. The Brooklyn Nets are noted as one of the youngest teams, with no players in the top 100 active scorers, while the league continues to explore new formats, such as an All-Star Game featuring U.S. versus international players. Cultural trends, such as multiple players named Jordan, Nikola, and James, also highlight broader societal patterns in player identity and naming.
title: NBA Season Begins with Record Global Player Representation and Plans for European League Expansion
